items.content: Introducing our 2019 Keystone Sponsor: Microsoft! Our top sponsors — companies who step forward to make the biggest investment in PyCon and its community — not only use Python for their own development but also offer Python as a crucial tool for their own customers. That is certainly true of PyCon’s Keystone Sponsor this year.cbr br /eI recently caught up with the Python Team at Microsoft to talk about how they're using Python and was excited to hear what they had to say.cbr br beQ: Is your organization using Python in any surprising ways?c/becbr /eYes, and in many surprising ways! To mention just three examples:cbr br uleclieWe have large swaths of data scientists whose jobs rely around Jupyter Notebooks. This includes our ca href=

esecurity analysis teamc/ae, which is constantly working to identify new security threats and protecting literally billions of users of Windows, Office, and our cloud services for consumers and businesses—every day.c/liecliePython is an important part of the CI/CD pipelines that are executed thousands of times every day to build and test Azure, Windows, and Office products and services.c/lieclieMany of our products and services are written in Python, including the Azure command-line tools (which come with ca href=

ean interesting storyc/ae), and Azure Notebooks.c/liec/ulePython has an incredibly productive language design, with a powerful set of packages and capabilities across scripting and automation, data science, and web development. This allows our engineers working in each of these scenarios to move faster and get more done.cbr br beQ: What is your organization most excited to share with the Python community at PyCon 2019?c/becbr /eWe are excited about sharing all the improvements for Python developers in our tools and services since PyCon 2018 last year. In Visual Studio Code we have continued to push out our monthly updates to the ca href=
ePython extensionc/ae, adding features like the new Test Explorer and the Python Interactive window with support for importing Jupyter notebooks. With ca href=

ePython in Azure Pipelinesc/ae, we’ve enabled developers to get cross-platform builds of Python packages  (for Mac, Windows and Linux) and publish them to PyPI or their own hosted private package feeds. In Azure we’ve released ca href=
enative Python support in Azure App Service on Linuxc/ae, making it easy to deploy your Django and Flask web apps to the cloud, and for those interested in serverless we’ve added support for ca href=
ePython in Azure Functions on Linuxc/ae.cbr br /eAnother exciting thing is that ca href=

ePython is now available in the Windows Storec/ae, and in the next major release of Windows you’ll be able to type “python” in the command prompt to install Python from the Store. This makes it possible for developers, especially in schools and enterprises, to start using Python without following complex install steps or needing admin privileges on their machine.cbr br /eWe are also planning to announce some new things at PyCon 2019, which we cannot share right now because they are top secret, so be sure to follow our ca href=

ePython blogc/ae and come by the Microsoft booth to find out what’s new! cbr br beQ: What is your organization most excited to learn more about at PyCon 2019?c/becbr /e We love learning more about what problems and pain points Python developers currently have and how we can help solve those problems with our tools, services, and CPython contributions.cbr /eThe conversations we have at PyCon, during sessions, at our booth, or just in the hallways, help inform where we focus our engineering efforts for the next year (for real!).cbr br beQ: What is the most valuable thing about sponsoring PyCon to your team?c/becbr /eThis is our second time as Keystone sponsors for PyCon, and we're excited to have the opportunity to show our appreciation and support for the work the Python developer community and the Python Software Foundation are doing. Our engineering team is coming to PyCon to connect with Python developers and to understand how we can offer better tools and services to help them write better apps, faster.cbr br /eAdditionally, Microsoft is helping maintain the CPython interpreter on Windows, and we want to learn from developers how we can design a better experience for them, whether they're expert programmers or students who are just starting.cbr br beQ: What does the future of Python look like from Microsoft’s vantage point? What sorts of things do you see for the community as a whole as well as Python within Microsoft itself?c/becbr /ePython is rapidly becoming the programming language of choice for people working in roles that have not traditionally involved writing code: we already see it spreading into fields as diverse as finance, biology, humanitarianism, and linguistics. As access to computation becomes universal, the Python community gets to empower people from all roles and backgrounds to achieve whatever is important to them.cbr br /eAs workloads diversify and the need to process large amounts of data increases, we see a future where Python is the great equalizer: the ideal language for anyone to write code that runs anywhere, flexible enough to take advantage of the intelligent cloud, lightweight enough to drive the intelligent edge, and rich enough to support developers in all fields and of all skills and experience level.cbr br /eAt Microsoft, we’re seeing dramatic growth in Python usage internally, and support for using our platforms and products with Python. ca href=

eIt didn't use to be the casec/ae. After many years building an open source culture within a huge company, we are very much enjoying getting to use our favorite tools at work. For everything for open-source developers from GitHub through to Python, the future at Microsoft looks bright! cbr br beQ: We’re thrilled that Microsoft has stepped forward again this year to make such a big investment in Python and its community. What would you like attendees to take away from your presence at PyCon?c/becbr /eMicrosoft has had a long history with Python and we are deeply committed to continue building tools and services for Python developers just as we have been doing for years. We also want attendees to know that we have comprehensive support for Python across our developer tools and cloud services, and not just on Windows!cbr br /eOur Visual Studio Code editor, which runs on macOS, Linux and Windows, is now the most popular free and open source editor among Python developers, according to the PSF’s 2018 Python developer survey.cbr br /eOn our Azure application platform, developers can run Python web apps on a managed Kubernetes service or on Azure App Service; and it also offers a rich set of features for users working with Machine Learning and AI, including free Jupyter Notebooks and Azure Machine Learning Studio. Lastly, Python developers can run CI/CD jobs for Linux, macOS and Windows on Azure Pipelines, which offers unlimited build minutes for open source projects.cbr br div class=

items.title: PyCon 2019 close to sell out!
items.content: We are all very excited that, once again, PyCon will sell out.  Time is running out so act fast if you are planning to attend, there are 60 tickets left as of April 12th at 11:00am central time.c/spanecbr table align=
eThings to remember:c/spanecbr br ulecliecspan style=
ePyCon Hotel Blocks are sold out, we suggest using online hotel booking sites to search for the best options near the Huntington Convention Centerc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eHotel changes and cancellations should be made by contacting the hotels directly.  c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eHotel cancellations should be made directly with the individual properties 48 hours prior to arrival to avoid a one night cancellation charge spanec/liec/ulecliecspan style=
eIf you indicated 'dietary allergy' when registering and have not provided specifics, please email ca href=
epycon-reg@python.orgc/ae with your dietary restrictions.c/spanec/liec/ulecliecspan style=
eApril 19th is the final date to submit an email requesting a conference registration cancellation for the $50.00 ($25.00 for students) cancellation fee.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 20th and after there will be no refunds for cancellations.  You will, however, be able to transfer the registration to another person after that date.  Further details can be found ca href=
eWe are looking forward to seeing everyone in Cleveland!c/spanec/divecdivecspan style=

items.title: PyCon 2019 Dietary Information
items.content: eWe are excited to be finalizing plans for PyCon 2019.  In our continued efforts to provide you as much information ahead of the conference as possible, we would like to inform you of the planned meals. We are excited to share with you some new features, please visit the website using the button below.c/spanec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableec/tdec/trectrectd id=
eIntroducing the new menu page on the PyCon website!cspanec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableectable border=

eThis page lists all menu items being offered for each meal. As we get closer to the conference we will try to list more detailed ingredients, allowing you to be informed prior to each day. cbr br strongeTutorial Days, May 1st and 2nd c/strongec/spanecbr ulecli style=
ecstrongeLunch:c/stronge will be buffet style providing VGN(Vegan), VEG(Vegetarian), and AVG(Avoid Gluten) options.c/spanec/liecli style=
eKosher and Allergy Needs: c/strongeLocation details will be posted on the webpage when available.c/spanec/liec/ulecdivecstrongecspan style=
eConference Days, May 3rd and May 4thc/spanec/strongec/diveculecli style=
eBreakfast: c/strongebuffet style, providing VGN(Vegan), VEG(Vegetarian), and AVG(Avoid Gluten) option. c/spanec/liecli style=

eLunch: c/strongewe are excited to be offering gourmet box lunches, with many delicious meals to choose from each day.  Each station will have a specific bowl style and within that specific bowl style, we offer VGN(Vegan), VEG(Vegetarian), and AVG(Avoid Gluten) options.c/spanec/liecli style=
eKosher and Allergy Needs: c/strongeLook for the ‘Kosher and Allergy Needs’ sign located in the left side of the Expo Hall, to pick up your meal.  See ca href=
eLunch: c/strongeMay 6th and 7th will be buffet style, providing VGN(Vegan), VEG(Vegetarian), and AVG(Avoid Gluten) optionc/spanec/liecli style=
eLunch: c/strongeMay 8th and 9th are box lunches, providing VGN(Vegan), VEG(Vegetarian), and AVG(Avoid Gluten) optionsc/spanec/liecli style=
eKosher and Allergy Needs: c/strongeLocation details will be posted on the webpage when availablec/spanec/liec/ulecdivecspan style=
ecstrongeEvening Dinnersc/stronge at the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and Great Lakes Science center menus can be found on the ca href=
eevent pagec/ae.cbr br /ePlease note that the kitchen cannot guarantee that all items will be 100% Gluten Free as all meals are prepared in the same facilities. Please contact ca href=

epycon-reg@python.orgc/ae if you need specific consideration for Gluten contents of food.cbr br /eIf you have indicated Kosher or Specific Allergies when you registered, you will receive an email prior to the conference providing more details.  If you have yet to provide specific cspan class=

items.title: Call for Volunteers!
items.content: eVolunteers are what makes PyCon such a successful event.  There are over 400 volunteer hours for over 15 different events that need to be filled.  This means there are options to fit everyone's interests.c/spanecbr br ulecliecspan style=
ecbeSession Staffc/be - an important piece in keeping things running smoothly.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeGreen Room Staffc/be - assist speakers in making sure they are ready to present.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeRegistration Deskc/be - a great way to meet attendees and be their first contact at the conference.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeSwag Bagc/be - there are lots of people needed to help with Swag Bag stuffing and this is a fun event!c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeTutorial hostsc/be - need to be onsite May 1st and May 2nd.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeLanguage Summit Greetersc/be - need to be onsite May 1st.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeYoung Coders Set-up and Assistancec/bec/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbePyLadies Auctionc/be - be sure you have a ticket to attend.c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbe5K Fun Runc/be - for all you early risers!c/spanec/liec/ulecdivecspan style=
ecieNote: All volunteers need to be registered for the conference.c/iec/spanec/divecspan style=
esign up herec/ae as a volunteer!c/spanecbr span style=

items.content: With great excitement, we're happy to announce the much anticipated (and admittedly delayed) lineups for PyCon 2019's Talks, Charlas, Posters Session, and Education Summit.cbr diveculeclieca href=

Their hard work provides the foundation for a vibrant conference with something for everyone.c/divech4ePyCon Program Committeec/h4ecdiveChair: Jason Myersc/divecdiveCo-Chairs: Lorena Mesa & Jackie Kazilc/divecdiveAnd the 34 volunteer reviewers!cbr h4ePyCon Charlas Teamc/h4ec/divecdiveChair: Maricela Sánchezc/divecdiveCo-Chairs: Mario Corchero and Naomi Cederc/divech4ePyCon Posters Committeec/h4ecdiveChair: Rebecca Bilbroc/divecdiveCo-Chairs: Kristen McIntyre, Nathan Danielsen, and Natalie Serebryakovac/divech4eEducation Summit Committeec/h4ecdiveChair: Meenal Pantcbr o-Chairs: Jessica Ingrasselino, Chalmer Lowe, Elizabeth Wickes, and Jeff Elknerc/divecdivecbr /divecdiveca name='more'ec/aeWe hope you're as excited to review the schedules as we are to share them. See you in Cleveland!c/dive

items.title: Hatchery programs at PyCon 2019!
items.content: The PyCon Hatchery program was introduced last year to allow for the addition to PyCon of new tracks, summits, demos, or any other imaginable events which share and fulfill the mission of the Python Software Foundation.cbr br /eThe Hatchery program was first run as a trial in 2018, welcoming the PyCon Charlas as it’s inaugural program. This year we are happy to have built upon that trial and are delighted to have received so many proposals and to have accepted many more events!cbr br beciePyCon Charlasc/iec/be will be returning in 2019, PyCon Charlas (
is the Spanish word for conference

) will be a full day track of Python talks en Español and is open to the entire Python community.  This track will showcase Spanish speaking Pythonistas from a variety of countries. Their schedule will launch later this week so stay tuned! ca href=

eus.pycon.org/2019/hatchery/charlas.c/aecbr br beNew this year for PyCon 2019!c/becbr br becieThe Art of Pythonc/iec/be is a miniature arts festival focusing on narrative, performance, and visual art. We intend to encourage and showcase novel art that helps us share our emotionally charged experiences of programming (particularly in Python). We hope that by attending, our audience will discover new aspects of empathy and rapport, and find a different kind of delight and perspective than might otherwise be expected at a large conference. For more details and information to submit a proposal visit ca href=

ecbecieMaintainers Summitc/iec/be is seeking to build a community of practice for project maintainers and key contributors. We seek to help the Python community sustain and grow healthy projects and communities. Activities will include talks and mini unconference around technology, community, resourcing, and more as it relates to package maintenance. For more details and information to submit a proposal visit ca href=

eus.pycon.org/2019/hatchery/maintainersc/ae.cbr br becieMentored Sprints for Diverse Beginnersc/iec/be is a newcomer’s introduction to contributing to open source. Walking the path from user to collaborator, and thus contributing to an open source project, can sometimes be intimidating especially for newcomers. We also recognize that some groups are traditionally underrepresented in the open source community and we would like to support them in their open source path. For these reasons, we are running the first ever PyCon mentored sprints for individuals from underrepresented groups willing to start contributing to Python projects. This event will provide a supportive, friendly, and safe environment for all the attendees and partner open source projects. For more details and information to submit a proposal visit ca href=

eus.pycon.org/2019/hatchery/mentoredsprintsc/ae.cbr br /eWe look forward to seeing you in Cleveland and hope that you’ll take some time to explore these exciting additions to the schedule!c/spanec/divec/dive

items.title: PyCon 2020-2021 Location
items.content: eNow that registration and planning are well underway for PyCon 2019 in Cleveland, the PSF is pleased to announce that the home for PyCon 2020 and 2021 will be Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania!c/spanecbr span style=
eThe conference will be held in the beautiful ca href=
eDavid L. Lawrence Convention Centerc/ae on April 15-23, 2020 and May 12-20, 2021.c/spanecbr span style=
ePhoto: David L. Lawrence Convention Centerc/spanec/spanec/spanec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableec/divecspan style=
eThe Steel City is built around the convergence of the Ohio, Allegheny, and Monongahela rivers and offers an understated mix of arts, culture, and technology. Join the ca href=
ePittsburgh Python User Groupc/ae for a meetup, eat dinner in a converted train station at the ca href=
eGrand Concoursec/ae, take a century-old cable car up the ca href=
eDuquesne Inclinec/ae to see stunning views of the city, or visit the ca href=
eRobot Hall of Famec/ae at the ca href=
eCarnegie Science Center's roboworld® exhibitc/ae. While you're out and about, see if you can count all 446 bridges in the city (that's more than you'll find in Venice, Italy)!c/spanecbr span style=
eIn Pittsburgh, you'll find that the residents are all neighbors. And with ca href=
e90 unique neighborhoodsc/ae that make up the city, there is something new around every corner. Between diverse and intriguing arts programming ranging from ca href=
eexperimental visual artsc/ae to the rich sports history of the ca href=
eCity of Championsc/ae, exhibited at museums like the ca href=
eClemente Museumc/ae or at any of the city’s ca href=
eiconic sports facilitiesc/ae, it’s clear to see that Pittsburgh has quite a story to tell.c/spanecbr h3 style=

eKnown Conflicts for PyCon 2020-2021c/spanec/spanec/h3ecieEDIT:c/iecbr ieBased on community feedback we received, we have updated the list of date conflicts to include additional holidays and events. This list is meant to be a thorough list of all events or holidays attendees may want to be aware of.c/iecbr iecbr /iecieWe appreciate all input and strive to be thoughtful and considerate to all people as best as we can when selecting conference dates. We also work to be transparent about conflicts and how dates are chosen for PyCon. For more information, see our blog post on ca href=
eHow & why cities and dates are selected for PyConc/ae. If you have any additional dates or concerns, please let us know at ca href=
epycon-local@python.orgc/ae.c/iecbr br /eThus, here are the known holidays and events during PyCon 2020-2021:cbr span style=
e2020: April 15 to April 23c/spanec/becbr ulecliecspan style=
eApril 15 (First day of Tutorials) - 7th Day of Passoverc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 15 (First day of Tutorials) - Tax Dayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 16 (Second day of Tutorials) - Last Day of Passoverc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 17 (First day of Talks) - Orthodox Good Fridayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 18 (Second day of Talks) - Orthodox Holy Saturdayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 19 (Third day of Talks) - Orthodox Easterc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 20 (First day of Sprints) - Orthodox Easter Mondayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 21 (Second day of Sprints) - Yom HaShoahc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eApril 23 (Last day of Sprints) - Take our Daughters and Sons to Work Dayc/spanec/liec/ulecbr becspan style=
e2021: May 12 to May 20c/spanec/becbr ulecliecspan style=
eMay 13 (Second day of Tutorials) - Ascension Dayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eMay 13 (Second day of Tutorials) - Eid al-Fitr (End of Ramadan)c/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eMay 15 (Second day of Talks) - Armed Forces Dayc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
eMay 17 (First day of Sprints) - Shavuotc/spanec/liec/ulecbr span style=
eMark your calendars and we'll see you at PyCon 2020 and PyCon 2021 in Pittsburgh!c/spanecbr divecspan style=

items.title: PyCon 2019 Reminders and Information!
items.content: The first 30 days of 2019 have come and gone so quickly, we want to take a minute to provide some conference reminders and information.c/spanecbr span style=
ecbecstrikeeJanuary 31 2019c/strikee Extended to February 15, 2019c/be: Deadline to submit a proposal for Startup Row.  Please go ca href=
ecbeFebruary 12, 2019c/be: Deadline to submit applications for ca href=
ecbeFebruary 24, 2019c/be: Financial Assistance grants awardedc/spanec/liecliecspan style=
ecbeMarch 3, 2019c/be: Deadline to respond to the offer of Financial Assistancec/spanec/liec/ulecdivecspan style=

ePyCon 2019 Early Bird tickets have sold out but registration at regular price is still available. If you are planning to attend, register soon as tickets will sell out and you don't want to miss out on the largest Python Conference.c/spanec/divecdivecspan style=

eOur goal is to make PyCon accessible for all of our attendees.  We are once again proud to offer childcare for PyCon 2019. Bring your children along and for a fee of $50 per day*, they can enjoy their own conference experience. This is the fourth year that Big Time Kid Care (ca href=
ewww.bigtimekidcare.comc/ae) is providing this service.  There will be activities for all ages as well as snacks and lunch daily.c/spanec/divecdivecspan style=
e    *if you sign up for all three conference days, you will get one day complimentary!c/spanec/divecdivecspan style=
eTutorials will be launching in mid February.  Please watch for the launch onca href=
e us.pycon.orgc/ae or follow us on ca href=
eTwitterc/ae. The tutorials are very popular and will sell out quickly so don't wait to register once they launch.c/spanecbr span style=
eFor all those living in the cold areas, stay warm! c/spanecbr span style=
eWe are looking forward to seeing everyone in Cleveland in May!c/spanecbr span style=
e[photo] Cleveland sign at Lake Eriec/spanec/tdec/trec/tbodyec/tableecdiv class=

items.title: Eighth Annual PyLadies Auction at PyCon 2019
items.content: ePyLadies is an international mentorship community for women that use Python. Since it’s founding in 2011, PyLadies has continued to bring women into the Python community through a variety of methods, including hosting events in local PyLadies chapters and offering grant opportunities to attend PyCon. Their mission is to promote, educate and advance a diverse Python community through outreach, education, conferences, events, and social gatherings.c/spanecbr span style=
eThe Python Software Foundation (PSF) is proud to announce the Eighth Annual PyCon Charity Auction for 2019.c/spanecbr span style=

ePyCon 2018’s auction was a huge success raising over $30K! More than 40 items from sponsors and fellow attendees were auctioned. Attendance was overwhelming and, rather than turn more people away for 2019, we have decided to increase capacity this year!c/spanecbr span style=

eThe PSF subsidizes this event each year by covering the cost of the venue, food, and beverages. In addition, the PSF adds a substantial donation to the event after everything is auctioned off.  c/spanecbr span style=
eIf you are interested in donating and item for the auction send the information to pycon-auction@python.orgc/spanecbr h3ecspan style=
eThinking about becoming a Sponsor?c/spanec/h3ecspan style=

ecbeWe are hoping to find one or two companies who love what the PyLadies are doing and are willing to sponsor this wonderful event. It’s a great opportunity to let our community know that you support them. Sponsorships start at $7500. More information can be found ca href=
eherec/ae, or you can contact pycon-sponsors@python.org.c/bec/spanecbr span style=

ePyLadies also aims to provide a friendly support network for women and a bridge to the larger Python world. Anyone with an interest in Python is encouraged to participate! Check out local meetups ca href=
eThe auction is a fun and entertaining way to support the PyLadies community.c/spanecbr span style=
eWe hope to see you in Cleveland!c/spanecbr divecbr beCorrection c/be2019-02-23: “cspan style=

eStarted with the help of a grant provided by The Python Software Foundation (PSF)  in 2011,” was removed from the first paragraph and replaced with “Since it’s founding in 2011,”. A grant resolution was misinterpreted as seed funding, when in fact PyLadies was already founded and established.c/spanec/divec/divecdiv dir=
